duties_responsibilities.duty: Oversee the company’s Foreign Supplier Verification Program (FSVP); conduct compliance audits of food and foreign suppliers; review and analyze reports, identify gaps and resolve issues, and ensure all certifications for the suppliers are current and in good standing.
Review, update and maintain product specification sheets to standardize product information and ensure consistency and accuracy.
Maintain and update databases/systems of product specifications and supporting documentation.
Provide strategic regulatory advice and support regarding inquiries from customers and internal teams on ingredients, formulations, and associated requirements.
Assist in the approval of and ongoing performance management of suppliers.
Ensure compliance with applicable food safety regulatory requirements including USDA, FDA, FSVP, and Importing.
Responsible for overall Import Customs Compliance and prepare customs documents to ensure compliance with all customs clearance requirements, laws, and regulations.

Determine the correct HTS classification and Duty Rate for new and existing items; Maintain HTS Classification & Duty Rates; Consult with Customs Brokers regarding correct HTS classification and Duty Rates.
Ensure all Import documentation is properly labeled, filed, and available for review. Maintain Lists of Import Entry #’s, Files by Customs Broker, etc.

Help manage the import process by maintaining relationships with customs brokers and other third-party service providers. Support the team in resolving any unforeseen discrepancies with suppliers, customs brokers, and other third-party service providers.

skills.skill: Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP)
Knowledge of Federal (FDA/USDA) and state labeling regulations
Experience with maintaining & enforcing proper documentation & protocol to follow FSVP requirements
Experience in Imports, Customs Compliance, and documentation
Experience in distribution, supply chain, or warehouse environment
Working with Registrar Corp, or other similar vendors, to implement and oversee Food Safety Compliance

education_certification.credential: Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP) certification
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Master's preferred)
